content:
Invitation sent out for next call. Please DM or mail me at espen.stranger.seland@ehelse.no if you need invitation.

Agenda: To be decided on the chat (in this thread). If no topics, we'll just postpone to November.

Is it today or next wednesday?

nevermind ... found it
In Finland there's some work being done on Scheduling. Is there any interest in Nordic collaboration on that?

@Mikael Rinnetmäki Personally I think that sounds interesting. In sweden we have a solution that is based on a central registry of bookable times (correct me if I'm wrong). Then there are the Argonaut initiatives which to me looks more like calendar bookings, but I have not seen it implemented. So it would be very interesting to see what other countries are doing in this area.
The authors of the FHIR Scheduling work consider the November call a better fit to present the project, with initial results. Let's add it to the agenda of that call, OK?
There are some people working on appointment scheduling in Norway as well. Would be interesting to se what different approaches the other conutries in the Nordics take in this area.

Scheduling in November is noted.

If there are no other topics, my proposal is to cancel the upcoming call and invite to the November call.

FYI - HL7 Norway will arrange a F2F-workshop on November 4th that will discuss Norwegian basis-profiles for Encounter and Appointment (in addition to Observation Vital signs). Hopefully that will contribute to some good input to the November meeting. Cheers,
I'm on U.S. west coast time zone and can't make it this time. Have a good call!
